SEARCH
Package org.thamindu.realtimeticketing.model

Class TicketPool

java.lang.Object
org.thamindu.realtimeticketing.model.TicketPool
@Component @Scope("singleton") public class TicketPool extends Object
Represents the shared ticket pool in the Real-Time Event Ticketing System. This class acts as a synchronized queue where tickets are added by vendors and retrieved by customers.

Rationale: A shared resource like a ticket pool requires thread-safe operations to ensure data integrity in a concurrent environment. Semaphores and synchronized blocks are used to manage access and prevent race conditions.

  • Constructor Details

    • TicketPool

      @Autowired public TicketPool(@Value("${ticket.pool.maxCapacity:50}") int maxCapacity, @Value("${ticket.pool.totalTickets:100}") int totalTickets)
      Constructs a TicketPool with a specified maximum capacity and total tickets.
      Parameters:
      maxCapacity - the maximum number of tickets that can be held in the pool at a time.
      totalTickets - the total number of tickets to be added to the pool.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum capacity is less than or equal to zero.

      Rationale: Constructor ensures proper initialization of critical fields and prevents invalid configurations.

  • Method Details

    • stopSimulation

      public void stopSimulation()
      Stops the simulation by setting the stopped flag to true.

      Rationale: A volatile flag ensures consistent visibility across threads, allowing for safe termination of operations.

    • addTicket

      public boolean addTicket(String ticketBase)
      Adds a ticket to the pool.
      Parameters:
      ticketBase - the base identifier for the ticket.
      Returns:
      true if the ticket was successfully added, false otherwise.

      Rationale: Synchronization ensures thread-safe ticket addition, while semaphores prevent overfilling the pool.

    • removeTicket

      public String removeTicket()
      Removes a ticket from the pool.
      Returns:
      the removed ticket, or null if the pool is empty or stopped.

      Rationale: Synchronization ensures thread-safe ticket retrieval, while semaphores prevent retrieving from an empty pool.

    • getTotalTickets

      public int getTotalTickets()
      Returns the total number of tickets.

      the total number of tickets.

      Sets the number of available tickets.

      Returns the number of tickets added to the pool.

      the number of tickets added.

      Returns:
      the maximum capacity of the pool.

    • isSimulationComplete

      public boolean isSimulationComplete()
      Checks if the simulation is complete.
      Returns:
      true if all tickets have been added and the pool is empty, false otherwise.
